contentrichtext.text: {{Italic title prefixed|3}} Three ships of the [[United States Navy]] have been named '''USS ''Manley''''' for [[John Manley (naval officer)|John Manley]]. *{{USS|Manley|TB-23}}, was a [[torpedo boat]] purchased in 1898, served in the Spanish-American War, left active service in 1914, renamed ''Levant'' in 1918 and sold in 1920. *{{USS|Manley|DD-74}}, was a [[Caldwell class destroyer|''Caldwell''-class]] [[destroyer]], commissioned in 1917, served in World War I, decommissioned in 1922, recommissioned in 1930, served in World War II and decommissioned in 1945. *{{USS|Manley|DD-940}}, was a [[Forrest Sherman class destroyer|''Forrest Sherman''-class]] destroyer, commissioned in 1957 and decommissioned in 1983. {{Shipindex}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Manley}} [[Category:United States Navy ship names]]
